did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Wright family papers (series 27)

bioghist.p: The Wright family is allied to the Houston family through the marriage of Susanna Wright and Dr. John Houston. Susanna Wright was the daughter of John Wright, a prominent local figure who owned the only ferry at an important crossing of the Susquehanna River between Columbia and Wrightsville, Pennsylvania. She married Dr. John Houston, and they raised nine children. Their youngest child, Samuel Nelson Houston, was the father of Henry Howard Houston.

scopecontent.p: The Wright family papers contain two deeds (1803, 1804) of Wright, Atlee, and Boude; verse by Susanna Wright (1761); genealogical records of the family (c. 1780); a promissory note (1877); correspondence, articles, and clippings regarding the Wright's Ferry Mansion; photographs of painted portraits of family members; and engravings of Wright's Ferry and the Columbia Bridge.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
